I agree the current code  may cause confusion.
(As @ikhoon pointed out, reqUri is set for each connection indicating the URI used when opening the connection. This uri may have no relation with other requests that may use this connection, potentially leading to bugs or unexpected behavior)
We can't avoid using URI since ProxySelector API highly depends on it.
Instead, I've tried to generify reqUri (by only leaving the host/port) and renamed it to connUri (or connectionUri).
Additionally, it seemed like PoolKey contains all related information needed (host, port), so I've modified channel.attr to remember PoolKey instead. (and removed ProxyContext)
Let me know if this looks better than the previous impl.

timeline.bodyText:
I feel like this change deserves some explanation:
Endpoint.toUri requires a serialization format (which was always none before introducing this method)
However, serialization format may not necessarily be none. (i.e. tbinary calls with proxy)
On the other hand, a session shouldn't necessarily only use a single serialization format, hence I moved away from using Scheme for the callback methods.
Hence, I'd decided to omit SerializationFormat entirely from the uri scheme.
